brief_description: "State Food Yojana (Yellow Ration Card)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department Of Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides food per month at a nominal rate to the yellow ration card holder of the state.
detailed_description: &quot;State Food Yojana (Yellow Ration Card)&quot; is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department Of Food, Civil Supplies &amp; Consumer Affairs, Government of Uttarakhand.Under this scheme, 7.50 K.G. rice per month at a cost of ₹11/- per K.G. is provided to the yellow ration card holder of the state.
benefits: 7.50 K.G. rice per month at a cost of ₹11/- per K.G.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. Annual family income of the applicant should be ₹5,00,000/- or less.

steps: Step 1: To apply for the Yellow Ration Card, the applicant needs to collect the application form from the office of the Panchayat Development Officer/ Supply Inspector/ Regional Food Officer/ District Supply Officer of the concerned area. Step 2: Attach all the mandatory documents( Self attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the application at the office of the Panchayat Development Officer/ Supply Inspector/ Regional Food Officer/ District Supply Officer of the concerned area. Step 4: The concerned person can get the ration card by contacting the District Supply Office within 10 days.

documents_required: Aadhaar card of all the family members, Photo of the Village Head, Phone Number, Bank Account Details, Gas Connection Details, Voter ID card, PAN Card, Income Certificate, Electricity Bill.
